main event: A witness observed an orange light moving straight up from Grand Valley, Colorado for about 10-15 seconds on March 18, 1968.
interesting points: The witness saw the light go out and then relight a few seconds later., The light was reported to have stayed on for approximately ten seconds., This sighting was attributed to the launch of an ATHENA missile from Green River, Utah., The characteristics of the missile's booster matched those described by the witness., There was only one confirmed witness to this observation.
sighted object: an orange light in the sky
witness description: the observer was facing southwest when the sighting occurred
